column1: The Grid Reference is for rain gauges shown on old maps adjacent to a location called Brown Hill. The elevation for this location ties up with that on the record sheets
The records from1876 to 1899 were reported only as annual totals
The gauge readings were regularly noted as being 6 inches too low and the gauge position was noted as being overexposed

A new gauge was placed at a lower altitude (727 ft.) about 350 yards West of the Old Gauge, which overlapped the Old Gauge from Jan 1931 to May 1943. The New Gauge generally measures lower than the old by an average of 1.44 inches
